dialogue.raw_text: Thebes. City of the Living. Crown jewel of Pharaoh Seti the First.

direction.raw_text: A gorgeous, olive-skinned goddess enters the outer foyer. It takes us a moment to realize that the skin-tight dress she's wearing isn't a dress at all, but rather her entire naked body has been PAINTED in the ancient Egyptian manner She's a stunning sight to behold. This is ANCK-SU-NAMUN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She makes her way through the ornate statuary. The CAMERA comes to a stop on a CRACKED STONE FACE. A BEAT. And then it's eyes suddenly POP OPEN. It's really a strange looking TATTOOED MAN. Several more of these hideous, bald MEN stand nearby. They are the PRIESTS of Osiris. Imhotep's guys. Their eyes watch Anck-su-namun vanish through the bedroom curtains. Anck-su-namun embraces Imhotep, they kiss passionately, feverishly. Imhotep's hands roam over her perfect body, smearing the paint. The Narrator's VOICE fills with lust:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we realize that the Narrator is actually Imhotep himself on the other-side of the curtains, the bald Priests rush over and close the doors. But just as they do, the doors suddenly BURST OPEN. Pharaoh angrily strides in, looks at the Priests. The following DIALOGUE is in ANCIENT EGYPTIAN, -- SUBTITLED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Priests back away, scared shitless, obviously his arrival was unexpected. Pharaoh strides for the curtains. Throws them back. Anck-su-namun stands alone. Gives him a sexy smile. Pharaoh sees the smeared body paint. Points his finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From behind him, his sword is ripped out of its scabbard. Pharaoh spins around. It's Imhotep. Pharaoh is shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind him, Anck-su-namun lifts a dagger and plunges it into his back. Pharaoh SCREAMS. Imhotep raises Pharaoh's sword. The hideous bald Priests SLAM the doors and bolt them tight. Through the curtains, they see the SHADOWS of Anck-su-namun and Imhotep stab away at Pharaoh. Suddenly, the doors are RAMMED from the other side, --WHAM! Imhotep and Anck-su-namun turn and look. --WHAM! The doors are RAMMED again. The two lovers share desperate looks. --WHAM! The bald Priests run up and grab Imhotep and try and pull him towards the balcony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imhotep tries to break free, but Anck-su-namun rips Pharaoh's sword out of his hand and pushes him towards the balcony.

direction.raw_text: Imhotep's face fills with despair. The DOORS EXPLODE OPEN.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Home of Imhotep, High Priest of Osiris, Keeper of the Dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Birthplace of Anck-su-namun. Pharaoh's Mistress. No other man was allowed to touch her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But for our love, we were willing to risk life itself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Imhotep?... My priest.

dialogue.raw_text: Pharaoh's bodyguards!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You must go. Save yourself. Only you can resurrect me.

direction.raw_text: with BLUE-TINTED SKIN and strange PUZZLE-TATTOOS over their bodies stride in, armed to the teeth. These are the MUMIA. The Priests hustle Imhotep out onto the dark balcony just as the Mumia rip through the curtains. Anck-su-namun points at Pharaoh and hisses -- ANCK-SU-NAMUN My body is no longer his temple! She PLUNGES the sword into her own heart. Out on the balcony, Imhotep's mouth opens into a horrible silent scream...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: For murdering Pharaoh, Anck-su-namun's body was to be cursed. And it was I, the High Priest, whose duty it was to curse it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Imhotep leads-a TORCH-LIT procession across the dunes. Anck- su-namun's mummy is carried by NUBIAN SLAVES. They put her down in the sand along with FIVE JEWEL ENCRUSTED JARS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imhotep, filled with dread, reads from a OBOOKO made out of pure GOLD. THIS IS THE BOOK OF THE LIVING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strange LIGHT suddenly FLASHES across the faces of the slaves and the EGYPTIAN SOLDIERS. Suddenly, everyone's fear-filled eyes all rise, as if watching Anck-su-namun's body rising. Then one last HUGE FLASH, accompanied by a BLAST OF WIND, and it's over. Anck-su-namun's body now lies twisted on the ground. Imhotep's Priests place the body into a stone sarcophagus. The Nubian slaves lower it into a hole and bury it with sand. Imhotep then signals to the Soldiers, who throw their spears at the Nubians. Killing them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imhotep's knife-wielding Priests attack the now unarmed Soldiers, hacking at them in the flickering darkness as Imhotep and the Mumia solemnly watches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mumia walk off across the sand and then, one by one, the Priests stop their frenzied stabbing and stare off at the vanishing Mumia. As the last Mumia disappears over a distant dune, Imhotep nods, and the Priests leap onto Anck-su-namun's grave and begin digging it back up with their hands.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THIS IS THE BOOK OF THE LIVING

dialogue.raw_text: Her body was mummified, her vital organs removed and placed in sacred canopic jars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Book of The Living contained sacred incantations that would send the evil dead on a journey into the dark underworld.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The slaves were killed...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...and the soldiers who killed them were also slain, so that no unholy person should ever know the exact location of the burial site.

direction.raw_text: race out into the moonlit desert. Imhotep leads the way. A "hearse" carries Anck-su-namun's mummy. THE MAP OF ANCIENT EGYPT FADES UP. The chariots race across the map.

direction.raw_text: The chariots arrive at a place marked on the map in hieratic. They race up the stone ramp and in through the city gates.

dialogue.raw_text: But there was another book, The Book Of The Dead, which was never to be opened, never to be read, for it contained the incantations that could bring a dead body back to life a most unholy thing.

dialogue.raw_text: - City of the Dead
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was hidden at Hamunaptra, City of the Dead, inside the statue of Anubis, so that no such sacrilege might ever disgrace Egypt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Imhotep pulls an ORNATE CHEST out of a SECRET COMPARTMENT inside the giant STATUE OF ANUBIS. He opens the chest and lifts out THE BOOK OF THE DEAD, made of black stone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: But for my love of Anck-su-namun I was willing to defy the gods.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Big hairy RATS scurry through the mausoleums and over the headstones of this very large, scary, UNDERGROUND CEMETERY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: surrounds the cemetery, -- muck made out of filthy water and human remains. Skulls bob in the goop. The Priests have gathered in a circle. Their hooded, lifeless eyes seem dead to this world. Their bald heads rock back and forth as they CHANT, a quiet eerie HUM. Heinous creatures. In the middle of the circle is a strange, twisted ALTAR. Imhotep has unwrapped Anck-su-namun's gorgeous, lifeless body and placed her five sacred canopic jars around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Imhotep begins to read from The Book of The Dead, a large SWIRLING HOLE starts to open in the detritus bog. Several Priests look over at it, frightened, then quickly look back down and resume CHANTING. A strange MIST wafts up out of the swirling hole and over to the jars, it passes through them and into Anck-su-namun's body. One of the jars SHUDDERS, the heart inside begins to BEAT. The CHANTING PRIESTS, SWIRLING HOLE, WAFTING MIST, BEATING HEART and IMHOTEP'S READINGS are reaching a crescendo. Anck-su-namun's EYES suddenly FLY OPEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imhotep lifts a sacrificial knife above Anck-su-namun's breast, about to plunge it down. The CHANTING, SWIRLING and BEATING heart CLIMAX. And that's when the Mumia BURST IN and storm through the startled Priests. The HEAD MUMIA SMASHES the jar with the beating heart. The MIST instantly sucks back out of Anck-su-namun's body and IMPLODES back into the swirling hole. Anck-su-namun's eyes close. Dying once again. Imhotep SCREAMS in rage. The Mumia grab him and his Priests.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: CHANTING PRIESTS, SWIRLING HOLE, WAFTING MIST, BEATING HEART

dialogue.raw_text: Anck-su-namun's vital organs were still fresh, so a human sacrifice would not need be made.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anck-su-namun soul had come back from the dead! Now all that was needed, was to return her organs to their rightful place within her body.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My Priests were condemned to be mummified alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: WE QUICKLY CUT TO IMHOTEP'S FACE,

direction.raw_text: Inside a TORCH-LIT CHAMBER, Imhotep is held by Anubis-headed EMBALMERS. He cringes at the flickering, impressionistic glimpses of his Priests being embalmed and mummified alive. The horrid-looking Embalmers, using knives, needles and thread, calmly perform their ghastly surgery on the SCREAMING Priests, who are going insane from the procedure. A red hot POKER is pulled out of a pit of burning coals. A Priest's head is wedged between two strong boards. His eyes widen in terror as an Embalmer moves to insert the red hot poker up his nose. But just before he does, WE QUICKLY CUT TO IMHOTEP'S FACE, horrified, as OFF CAMERA, the Priest SCREAMS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the chamber. All twenty-one of Imhotep's Priests squirm inside their wrappings. Imhotep is forced to his knees. His arms are held back. His mouth is pried open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Using a pair of tongs, an Embalmer slowly pulls Imhotep's TONGUE out of his mouth, then places a very sharp knife on top of it. WE GO TIGHT on IMHOTEP'S EYES as his tongue is apparently cut out. The Embalmer flings Imhotep's tongue onto the floor. The Mumia's dogs attack and quickly eat it. Imhotep is WRAPPED ALIVE. Only his mouth, nostrils and fearfilled eyes are left free of the slimy bandages. Detritus muck boils inside a black cauldron. Embalmers scoop out the fetid muck and apply it to Imhotep's wrappings as he squirms. He's then laid in a wooden COFFIN inside a stone SARCOPHAGUS. An Embalmer with a BUCKET steps up and looks into the coffin. Imhotep's wild eyes stare back. The Embalmer empties the bucket over Imhotep's chest: dozens of SCARABS, disgusting dung beetles. They scurry across Imhotep's SCREAMING face. Some vanish into his tongue-less mouth and up his nostrils.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lid to the coffin is SLAMMED SHUT. Then, using a strange four-sided KEY, the Head Mumia locks the coffin lid tight. The heavy sarcophagus lid is shoved into place and with a loud WHOOSH seals itself airtight. Once again, the Head Mumia uses the strange key, locking the sarcophagus lid tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blue-skinned, strangely tattooed man carefully collapses the sides of the key, -- turning it into a little puzzle BOX.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imhotep's sarcophagus is dropped into a DETRITUS PIT. The disgusting muck SPLASHES up, drools down it-s sides, and then is mysteriously sucked into It's seams, vanishing clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imhotep's horrifying tongue-less SCREAMS can be heard coming from inside his sarcophagus as grave diggers shovel dirt onto it. THE MAIN TITLE IS SUPERIMPOSED ON THE SCREAM:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The heavily armed Mumia stand guard around Imhotep's grave. Looking down on the burial site is the huge statue of ANUBIS, the jackal-headed god of death. It stares at us. Then begins to DECAY before our very eyes, aging 4,159 years in only seconds. And then we find ourselves and the decrepit, half- buried statue of Anubis out in the middle of the desert.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: As for me, I was condemned to endure the HOM-DAI. The worst of all ancient curses. One so horrible, it had never before been bestowed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: By eating the sacred scarabs, I would be cursed to stay alive forever. And by eating me, they were cursed just the same.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was to remain sealed inside my sarcophagus, the undead for all of eternity.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They would never allow me to be released. For I would arise a walking disease, a plague upon mankind, an unholy flesh-eater, with the strength of ages, power over the sands, and the glory of invincibility.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: THE MAIN TITLE IS SUPERIMPOSED ON THE SCREAM

dialogue.raw_text: And if I could raise my beloved Anck- su-namun from her place in hell, together, we would be an unstoppable infection upon this world. The Apocalypse. The End.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Imhotep's horrifying SCREAMS become the SCREAMS of a TUAREG HORSEMAN. Racing across the desert with two thousand of his warrior brethren. Armed to the teeth. SUPERIMPOSED across the SCREEN are the WORDS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A mile across the scorching desert TWO HUNDRED FRENCH FOREIGN LEGIONNAIRES scurry through the ruins, preparing for the onslaught. OUR HERO is up on the wall. His Kepi sits at a jaunty angle. Dashing and handsome. This is RICK O'CONNELL. He looks out at the massive SCREAMING horde galloping at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A doughy little Frenchman joins him as he makes his way across the top of the wall. This is BENI.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beni pulls off his cartridge belt. Hands it to O'Connell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell throws it on, crisscrossing his own bandolier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beni pulls out his pistol and chucks it to O'Connell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell slides it into his belt, next to his own revolver
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell turns and goes nose-to-nose with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The horde of warriors THUNDERS forward. Now a half mile out. Scimitars RATTLING. O'Connell and Beni run through the ruins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beni trips and accidentally tackles O'Connell to the ground. O'Connell gives him a nasty look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They get up and run out the gate and down the stone ramp
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both skid to a stop at the front line as they see the horde of warriors. The SOUND of CHARGING HORSES is deafening. O'Connell gives Beni a big cheesy smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's when the cowardly Legionnaire Colonel suddenly panics, cuts and runs. O'Connell instantly stiffens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gives the men around him courage. But onward comes the horde Hoofs pounding the sand. Several more Legionnaires take off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Tuaregs let loose with those horrifying oooo-loo-loog SCREAMS. More Legionnaires haul-ass. Beni is one of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Tuaregs set their rifles and take aim. O'Connell steels himself, cocks and locks. The cartridge in his mouth suddenly snaps, he spits it into the sand. Another BEAT. And then -- O'CONNELL FIRE! The Legionnaires on the ground FIRE. The rifles report with a CRASH. The BLAST blows dozens of Tuaregs clean off their mounts. The prone Legionnaires quickly begin to reload.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kneeling Legionnaires FIRE. More Tuaregs bite the sand. The remaining warriors OPEN FIRE. THUNDER and SMOKE rip the hot air. A third of the Legionnaires are killed instantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The remaining standing Legionnaires FIRE. Tuaregs spin off their mounts. Crash to the sand. And then the entire Tuareg force plows into the ruins and through the Legionnaires. O'Connell grabs the barrel of his rifle and starts CLUBBING riders off their steeds, fighting like a man possessed. Beni on the other hand, is bellycrawling across the sand, whimpering in full retreat as Legionnaires fall dead all around him. He crawls through the front gate. O'Connell throws his rifle down and goes for his guns. He cross-draws, gun in each hand, starts blowing riders off their mounts. Beni crawls faster, and then he spots an open TEMPLE DOORWAY amongst the rocks. He gets up and sprints for the door as the last of the Legionnaires are shot off their feet behind him. O'Connell's guns go empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns and runs like hell, right through the front gate. Four Tuareg warriors on massive Arabians haul-ass after him. O'Connell hurdles a stone column, hits the ground running. He spots Beni inside the Temple doorway, trying to close the heavy sandstone door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beni has no intention of waiting up, he pushes harder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell runs faster. Beni pushes harder. The four Horsemen LEAP the big column and CHARGE after him. HOOFS POUNDING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beni closes the door just as O'Connell reaches it. O'Connell SLAMS his body into the door. It doesn't budge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns and bolts off around the rocks. Running for his life, weaving through the ruins. The Arabians getting closer and closer. The POUNDING hoofs getting LOUDER and LOUDER. O'Connell finally spins around and faces his attackers. The four massive horses crash to a stop in front of him. The vicious Tuaregs raise their rifles to finish him off. O'Connell just stands there, exhausted and beaten, then he slowly lifts his right hand and gives them the bird. And that's when the horses go ape-shit. All four of them REAR UP. Two of the Riders are THROWN to the ground. The horses SCREECH and BELLOW and SNORT in fear, then buck like fury and haul-ass away as if the devil himself had scared them. The thrown Riders get up and race off after their mounts. O'Connell just stands there, stunned, then he lifts his right hand and checks out his middle finger. And then he feels the evil himself, and turns around. -- The shattered, decrepit statue of Anubis stares back at him. Suddenly, the sand begins to shift under O'Connell's feet. He starts to back away, keeping his eyes on the transforming sand, it looks like huge snakes are wiggling and writhing beneath it, forming lines and shapes, -- drawing a picture. O'Connell quickly turns and runs off through the ruins. The sand stops moving, and we can now see that, drawn in the sand, is a picture of IMHOTEP'S SCREAMING FACE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up on a ridge, A GROUP OF RIDERS watch O'Connell stumble clear of the decrepit city. O'Connell feels their presence and looks up. Very different from the Tuaregs, they have BLUE TINTED SKIN and faces covered in strange PUZZLE-TATTOOS. The Mumia. Still watching Imhotep's grave after all this time. The MUMIA LEADER is a huge, fierce Man in black robes, with dual scimitars across his waist. His face is both handsome and horrible, blue and tattooed. Meet ARDETH RAY. His dark eyes watch O'Connell stagger off into the open desert...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cairo, a city so old the stars have actually changed their positions in the sky since it's birth. A city teeming with every form of life. A strange, mysterious, wonderful city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it's name across the SCREEN:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAIRO MUSEUM OF ANTIQUITIES - DAY Deep in the bowels of the museum lie the STACKS. Rows upon rows of towering bookshelves. Filled with literature on the Antiquities. Standing at the top of a tall ladder between two of these rows and leaning against one of the bookshelves, is a rather uninteresting British GIRL: eye-glasses, hair-in- a-bun, long boring dress, your typical prudish nightmare. This is EVELYN CARNARVON. We're going to fall in love with her. Evelyn pulls a book out from a stack under her arm, blows the dust off it, then places it on a shelf with other books whose titles all begin with the letter "O". Then she grabs another book out from under her arm and reads the title.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carefully, so as not to lose her balance, she looks over her shoulder to the bookshelf behind her, where all the titles begin with the letter "T". Then she looks down. It's a long way to the bottom. Evelyn gently sets the other books down on the top shelf, then turns and gingerly starts to reach across the aisle with the Tuthmosis book. It's a little too far, so she stretches, reaching, holding the top of the ladder with her fingertips, she's almost got it, closer now closer. And that's when the ladder pulls away from the shelf. Evelyn YELPS, flings the Tuthmosis book and grabs the top of the ladder, which stands straight up. Evelyn holds her breath, swaying precariously, a long BEAT, and then she loses her balance, the ladder swings around and Evelyn starts stiltwalking down the aisle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ladder crosses the aisle, does an about face and heads back the way it came. Evelyn clings to the top, struggling for balance. The ladder teeters out into the main aisle and picks up speed. Evelyn SCREAMS as it does a 180, spins into another aisle and finally crashes to a stop at the top of a bookshelf. Evelyn holds her breath, then SIGHS HEAVILY. And that's when the bookshelf falls away from her and CRASHES into the next bookshelf. Evelyn slides down the ladder and plops to the floor. She looks up just as the domino effect kicks-in: each bookshelf crashing into the next. And onward it goes. Bookshelf after bookshelf. Thousands of volumes flinging off shelves and scattering across the floor. It finally ends as the last shelf CRASHES into a wall. Evelyn's eyes are closed. She opens one eye. Looks left. Then right. Then opens the other eye and stares at the huge mess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Egyptian CURATOR storms in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn quickly gets up and starts gathering books.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn turns to him, trying to contain herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Curator storms out. Evelyn just stands there, steaming. And then she hears a NOISE and quickly turns around. A BEAT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quiet. Eerie. And then she hears it again, like feet, slowly shuffling across the floor, coming from a nearby gallery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn walks through the stacks and enters -- INT. THE RAMESSEUM Filled with treasures and plunder from the Middle Kingdom. It's very dark and quiet in here, the only LIGHT is from FLICKERING TORCHES at either end of the spooky gallery. The NOISE again! From the far side of the room. Feet, slowly shuffling, plodding across the floor. Evelyn grabs a torch. Looks around, at a statue of Anubis, another of Horus, they stare down at Evelyn, who is starting to get scared now. She walks down the aisle. Past a closed sarcophagus. Past cases of ancient artifacts. Past another sarcophagus, -- only this one is OPEN! Evelyn freezes, swallows hard, nervously looks around to see who could have opened it. Then she slowly leans forward with the torch, and peers inside.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Look at this! Sons of the Messiah! Give me frogs, flies, locusts, anything but this! Compared to you, the other plagues were a joy!

dialogue.raw_text: Who needs smart women? I put up with you because your mother and father were our finest patrons, Allah rest their souls. Now straighten up this mess!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Abdul? Mohammed? Bob?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A hideous rotted MUMMY sits up and SCREECHES at her! Evelyn SCREAMS, drops the torch and backs away, scared out of her wits. And then, coming from inside the sarcophagus, she hears a Man LAUGHING. Her eyes narrow as a foppish cad crawls out from behind the Mummy, laughing his ass off, half drunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meet JONATHAN CARNARVON. As he crawls out of the sarcophagus, Evelyn pulls a cigarette out of the mummy's mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grins drunkenly. Evelyn punches him hard in the chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He BELCHES, then falls back and sits on the edge of a tomb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jonathan excitedly starts scrounging around in his jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jonathan pulls out a small, ancient BOX; the collapsed KEY to Imhotep's sarcophagus and coffin. Evelyn is instantly curious, she grabs the box out of his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jonathan knows her weaknesses, gives her a mischievous smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn rolls the box around in her hands, mumbling to herself as she translates the hieratics and hieroglyphs covering it. Jonathan licks his lips in anticipation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn's fingers play with the various little slats on the box, shifting them this way and that way, it's like a puzzle box. Then suddenly, it UNFOLDS ITSELF, almost-mechanically, turning itself into the KEY. Sitting inside the open key/box is a folded piece of GOLDEN PAPYRUS. An ANCIENT MAP.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You...! YOU...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Drunkard? Fool? Rat-bastard? Please call me something original.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you no respect for the dead?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right now, I only wish to join them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well I wish you'd do it sooner rather than later, before you ruin my career the way you've ruined yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My dear, sweet, baby sister, I'll have you know, that at this moment my career is on a high note.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: High note? Ha! For five years you've been scrounging around Egypt, and what have you to show for it? Nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh yes I do! I have something right here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no, not another worthless trinket, Jonathan, if I bring one more piece of junk to the Curator to try and sell for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where did you get this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On a dig, down in Thebes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My whole life I've never found anything, Evy. Tell me I've found something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jonathan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think you found something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Curator sits at his desk, staring through a jeweler's eyepiece at the key/box. Evelyn hovers behind him, excited.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jonathan leans in from across the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Curator picks up the MAP. It's actually the exact same map that we established in the opening scenes of the movie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Curator freezes, suddenly very nervous, then he recovers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Curator holds the map closer to the burning CANDLE-LAMP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The map 'accidentally,' CATCHES ON FIRE. The Curator throws it to the floor. Jonathan drops to his knees and quickly puts it out. Lifts it up. The left third of the map is now missing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Curator reaches for the key/box. Evelyn quickly snatches it off the desk and gives him a very angry, suspicious look.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: See the cartouche there, it's the official royal seal of Seti the First, I'm sure of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Two questions. Who the hell is Seti the First? And was he rich?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He was the last Pharaoh of the Old Kingdom, said to be the wealthiest Pharaoh of them all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright, good, that's good. I like this fellow, like him very much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've already dated it, this map is almost four thousand years old. And the hieratics over here... (Inhales deeply) It's Hamunaptra.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My dear girl, don't be ridiculous, we are scholars, not treasure hunters. Hamunaptra is a myth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are we talking about the Hamunaptra?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. The City of The Dead. Where the early Pharaohs were said to have hidden the wealth of Egypt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right, right, in a big underground treasure chamber. Everybody knows the story. The entire necropolis was rigged to sink into the sand. On Pharaoh's command, a flick of the switch! And the whole place could disappear beneath the dunes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All we know is that the city mysteriously vanished around 2,134 B.C.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As the Americans would say: it's all fairy tales and hokum.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You burned it! You burned off the part with the lost city!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's for the best, I'm sure. Many men have wasted their lives in the foolish pursuit of Hamunaptra, no one has ever found it, most have never returned.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (devastated) You killed my map.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sure it was a fake, anyway, I'm surprised at you, Miss Carnarvon, to be so fooled.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cairo prison. One of the worst hell holes on earth. Every low-life form of scumbag can be found here. The WARDEN, a first rate scumbag himself, escorts Evelyn and Jonathan across the gallows courtyard. Evelyn whispers to Jonathan.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You told me you found it on a dig down in Thebes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was mistaken.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You lied to me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I lie to everybody, what makes you so special?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm your sister.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That just makes you more gullible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You stole it from a drunk at the local Casbah?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Picked his pocket, actually.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Warden ushers Evelyn and Jonathan into the holding pen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The interior cell door BURSTS OPEN. O'Connell is in chains, dragged by FOUR GUARDS, they shove him up to the cell bars. From the looks of it, he's been here awhile; his face is half hidden by long hair, a scraggly beard and many new bruises. Evelyn looks at him, disgusted by his appearance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell gives Evelyn the once over, then looks at Jonathan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn is stunned and furious. The Warden heads out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A Guard CLUBS O'Connell across the head, O'Connell's face bounces off the metal bars. He shows no pain, but just looks back and gives the Guard a nasty look. Evelyn steps closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn and Jonathan quickly look around, hoping the guards didn't hear him. They step closer. Evelyn plays coy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn is dumbstruck. But Jonathan looks suspicious
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell looks closer at Jonathan, a glint of recognition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell's FIST comes flying through the bars, hits Jonathan square in the jaw, DECKS HIM. He hits the floor. Out cold. A Guard CLUBS O'Connell. His head bounces off the bars again. He shows no pain, but gives the Guard another nasty look. Evelyn looks down at her brother, then back at O'Connell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell almost smiles. There's a bit of spark to this girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The warden enters. Evelyn quickly leans closer to O'Connell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn leans in even closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She leans her face right up to the bars, nervous and excited
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell steps forward and KISSES her full on the lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn is stunned. A Guard CLUBS him, his face bounces off the bars again, but before he can react the Guards GRAB him, YANKS him away from the bars and DRAG him out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn is shocked. The warden shows-off his green teeth.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And what is he in prison for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I did not know, so when I heard you were coming, I asked him that myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what did he say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He said... he was just looking for a good time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But he's just a filthy criminal?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cringing) Way to go, Evy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So who's the broad?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Broad?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's my sister, actually.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah? Well,... I'm sure she's not a total loss.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be back in a moment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sarcastic) I tremble with anticipation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We uh,... found... your puzzle box, and we've come to ask you about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... You came to ask me about Hamunaptra.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you know the box pertains to Hamunaptra?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because that's where I found it. I was there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do we know that's not a load of pig swallow?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey,... don't I know you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Um, well, you see...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were actually at Hamunaptra?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just decked your brother
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, well... (shrugs) I know my brother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I was there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You swear?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Every damn day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I mean -- O'CONNELL -- I know what you mean. I was there, alright. Seti's place. The City Of The Dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did you find? What did you see?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I found sand. I saw death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could you tell me how to get there? The exact location?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Want to know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really want to know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then get me the hell outta here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where are they taking him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To be hanged.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Apparently, he had a very good time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hundreds of filthy PRISONERS stare down onto the gallows as the hangman's noose is draped over O'Connell's head and cinched tight around his neck. Evelyn follows the warden onto a balcony above the gallows. The prisoners all go dead quiet at the sight of her; like jackals staring at fresh meat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This seems to confuse the Warden, he shrugs and sits down. O'Connell looks up as Evelyn plops down beside the Warden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell can hear every word, he looks hopeful. Other than Evelyn, you could hear a pin drop. The HANGMAN turns to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Hangman grabs the lever to the trapdoor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Warden sets his greasy, lecherous hand on Evelyn's leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn is revolted, she quickly shoves his hand away. Insulted, the Warden angrily turns and gestures to the Hangman, who pulls the lever. The trapdoor DROPS AWAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell DROPS through the hole. The rope pays out. Then JERKS TAUGHT. O'Connell's body SNAPS at the end of the rope. But he's still alive, because -- WARDEN His neck did not break! Good! Now we watch him strangle to death. The prisoners go ape-shit, SCREAMING and SHOUTING in anger. The GUARDS look around, nervous. O'Connell struggles at the end of the rope, gagging. Evelyn is horrified, she quickly turns to the warden, leans forward and whispers in his ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The warden spins around and faces her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the end of the rope, O'Connell is choking and gagging and turning several shades of red. The Warden stares at Evelyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn hesitates, bites her lip. O'Connell's eyes bulge as he looks up at her, he can't believe this girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The warden flashes a big green smile, then YELLS in Arabic. A scimitar SLASHES the air. The rope is CUT. O'Connell CRASHES to the ground. Half dead. Rolls over. GAGGING. All of the prisoners BURST INTO CHEERS. O'Connell looks up at Evelyn. She smiles broadly and waves down at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No women allowed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am an English woman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will give you one hundred pounds to spare his life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I would pay one hundred pounds just to see him hang.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Two hundred pounds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Proceed!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Three hundred pounds!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any last requests, pig?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I'd like ya to let me go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what else?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He knows the location to Hamunaptra.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You lie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I would never!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you saying this filthy godless son of a pig knows where to find The City Of The Dead? Truly?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes and if you cut him down, we will give you ten percent.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fifty percent.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Twenty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give... give him... give him GLAAAA-- !
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Twenty-five percent, and not one single farthing more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT CANDLE LIGHT FLICKERS across the Curator's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Standing in the shadows across from his desk are THREE MUMIA: blue tinted skin, hideous facial tattoos, -- the works. One of the Mumia has a rusty metal HOOK for a hand. He shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Curator leans across his desk, fear in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spooks the hell out of the Mumia guys.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: She must die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She is like all the others. She will die in the desert.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! She has seen too much. She knows too much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not only does she have a map, but she has the key.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The key!? She has the lost key!?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. No one has ever had so much, been so close. We must stop her, or it will be the end of us all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then we will kill her, we will kill her and all those with her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And burn the map and retrieve the key.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It will be done. But what of the American expedition? They leave tomorrow as well.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forget the bumbling Americans, they will be like all the others. Without the map to guide them, how can they possibly find Hamunaptra?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : our old traitorous friend BENI.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It is three days down the Nile, then two days by camel, sahibs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: BACK: to reveal Beni standing on the bow of a PASSENGER BARGE. Surrounded by DANIELS, HENDERSON and BURNS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: For all the money we're paying you, something better god-damned well be under that sand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : as Henderson slaps Daniels on the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now we see all of GIZA PORT: Team of explorers swarm the docks. Across the Nile, the PYRAMIDS spike the sky. Evelyn and Jonathan walk along the boardwalk besieged by HAWKERS selling everything from toy tombs to King Tut action figures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both turn. O'Connell walks up; shaved, showered, spit and polished, with a new haircut and clothes. He looks more dashing and handsome than ever. Evelyn is suitably impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jonathan grabs O'Connell's arm and shakes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell quickly checks his pockets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He finds his wallet and relaxes. DIRECTLY ABOVE HIM: on the bow of the barge, Burns wipes his bifocals and turns to Beni.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's when Beni spots O'Connell. Beni shakes his head, as if seeing a mirage, then starts backing away from the men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beni quickly scurries off, vanishing down into the hold.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: "Hamunaptra," Daniels, that's all ya gotta keep sayin, to yourself, "Hamunaptra."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you really think he'll show up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Undoubtedly, I know the breed, he may be a cowboy, but his word is his word.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Personally, I think he's filthy, rude and a complete scoundrel. I don't like him one bit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Anyone I know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh... um,... hello.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Smashing day for the start of an adventure, eh, O'Connell?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, sure, smashing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're sure Hamunaptra is out there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Along with the scorched bones of my entire garrison, sahib.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A thousand pardons, my good sahibs but there is much work to be done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : Evelyn, recovering, she clears her throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell steps up close to Evelyn, invading her space looks her straight in the eye. Evelyn doesn't back away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell takes her bags and heads up the gangplank and onto the same passenger barge that Beni and the Americans are on. Evelyn's eyes follow him, a bit wistfully. Jonathan sees it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn gives him a look. Jonathan just grins. And that's when the warden suddenly brushes past, tipping his raggedy hat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And up the plank he goes. Evelyn and Jonathan share a look.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mister O'Connell, can you look me in the eye, and guarantee me this is not some sort of flimflam? Because if it is, I'm warning you --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All I can tell you, miss, is that my Colonel found that map in an ancient fortress, and the whole damn garrison believed in it so much, that without orders, we marched halfway across Libya and into Egypt to find that city. Like I told ya, all I saw was sand. Everybody else was wiped out by Tuareg warriors. I'll take your bags.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, yes, you're right, filthy, rude, a complete scoundrel, nothing to like there at all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A bright good morning to all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have come to protect my investment, thank you very much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: AGAIN: as the barge pulls out and heads down the Nile. WE TILT UP: to the SUN, which then DISSOLVES into -- EXT. RIVER NILE - NIGHT The MOON, shining down on the desert. The THREE VICIOUS MUMIA quietly glide a narrow skiff out onto the river. The one with the hook sits in the middle of the skiff, the other two row, heading for the PASSENGER BARGE coming their way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jonathan and the three Americans are playing poker. O'Connell comes out a door carrying a GUNNY-SACK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell returns Daniel's cocky look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burns slips on his dirty bifocals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henderson spits a wad of chew into a spittoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell's poker face drops, perplexed. Same with Jonathan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell 'accidentally' hits him in the ribs with the gunnysack, shutting him up. Jonathan quickly covers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sit down, O'Connell, sit down, we could use another good player.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I only gamble with my life, never my money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Never? What if I were to wager five hundred dollars says we get to Hamunaptra before you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yer on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What makes you so confident, sir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What makes you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We got us a man who's actually been there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I say, what a coincidence, why --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: whose deal is it? Is it my deal? I thought I just dealt?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evelyn sits on a table, staring out over the passing river. The gunny-sack DROPS onto the table, startling her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell reaches into the gunny-sack and starts pulling out revolvers, pistols, hunting knives, a massive elephant gun, and a half dozen carefully wrapped sticks of dynamite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This takes the smile off Evelyn's face. O'Connell starts dismantling and cleaning the guns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell looks into Evelyn's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gives him a know-it-all grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn is surprised by his knowledge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn gets up to go, then she hesitates, nervous, she turns back to O'Connell, and as matter-of-fact as possible says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell, cleaning his guns, just shrugs his shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn's eyes widen, furious, she turns and storms off. O'Connell looks up, watching her leave, a bit perplexed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then he hears someone SNICKERING under the table. He quickly reaches down, grabs that someone and lifts him up. It's Beni.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell sticks a knife under Beni's throat. Beni swallows hard, then tries to weasel his way out with a big grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell pulls the knife away. Beni relaxes, rubs his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look as they hear Evelyn YELP. A single CAMEL in the HORSE PADDOCK takes another bite at her. She YELPS again and backs away. O'Connell grins as Evelyn flees down the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell's eyes narrow at the insult, he looks back at Beni.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell grabs him and chucks him over the side of the barge. Beni SPLASHES into the river. O'Connell takes his gunny-sack and starts walking off down the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's when he spots THREE SETS OF WET FOOTPRINTS, coming up over the railing from the river and heading down the deck. O'Connell quickly looks around, immediately on the alert.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, didn't mean to scare ya.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The only thing that scares me, Mister O'Connell, are your manners.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Still angry that I kissed ya, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you call that a kiss.

direction.raw_text: The MOON shines down an four lone camel rider's trekking across the vast wasteland. Jonathan is sound asleep, his head bobbing comically to the rhythm of his camel. On the camel next to him, the Warden SNORES LOUDLY. Up in front of them, Evelyn slowly starts to slide off her saddle. O'Connell reaches over and stops her, then gently pushes her back up onto her saddle, never waking her. For a long moment, his eyes watch Evelyn, and then he looks up at a distant ridge -- -- where Ardeth Ray and a group of MUMIA RIDERS are pacing them.

direction.raw_text: The American Expedition rides out from behind the far end of the dune. The Americans are accompanied by TWO DOZEN NATIVE DIGGERS and an Arab EGYPTOLOGIST. Beni rides lead on a camel, the rest ride horses.

direction.raw_text: O'Connell just nods. The two parties come to a stop a hundred feet apart. O'Connell turns and stares out across the endless horizon. Beni does likewise. The Americans look puzzled.

direction.raw_text: O'Connell and Beni just stare out at the flat nothingness. Evelyn and Jonathan share a look. And then, the SUN starts to rise in the distance, breaking the flat horizon.

direction.raw_text: Evelyn can feel the suspense and the majesty of the moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Far off to the right, a HUGE SHAPE begins to rise with the sun. A VOLCANO. O'Connell and Beni watch it, expressionless. Daniels, Henderson and Burns share a look, and then -- DANIELS/HENDERSON/BURNS HEYA! The Americans take off. Racing towards the rising volcano.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn and Jonathan give O'Connell anxious, sarcastic looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell doesn't say a word, staring hard. Beni watches the Americans and spits into the sand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then suddenly, the volcano SHIFTS ACROSS THE HORIZON. Passing across the sun as it goes. It's a MIRAGE. The Americans crash their horses to a stop and race the other way, after the volcano. Evelyn and Jonathan smile, amazed. The volcano SHIFTS AGAIN, floating across the watery horizon. The Americans crash to a stop again and chase after the volcano. All three of them confused and CURSING. O'Connell and Beni just stare, waiting. The volcano SHIFTS AGAIN. And the Americans crash to a stop again. Burns is THROWN from his horse. Henderson angrily rips his hat off and chucks it to the ground. Daniels just curses as they give up the chase. The volcano comes to a stop on the far left of the horizon. The Americans are on the far right. Nothing moves. A BEAT. And then O'Connell grins. So does Beni. They share a look. And then SWAT their camels and RACE AWAY. Everybody else hauls-ass after them. O'Connell and Beni are neck-and-neck. And then Evelyn comes galloping up, hair flying in the wind. Beni takes out his camel whip and starts WHIPPING O'Connell. Trying to knock him off his camel. once. CRACK! Twice. CRACK! But on the third try O'Connell grabs the whip and JERKS Beni off his camel. Beni SLAMS to the ground and TUMBLES. Evelyn and O'Connell race across the desert. Evelyn has never felt so alive. She LAUGHS. O'Connell grins; he likes this girl. Beni stumbles to his feet, then quickly dances out of the way as Jonathan and all the other riders stampede past him. Evelyn beats O'Connell to the stone ramp, racing hard.

The Diggers give one final pull and -- -- AN INTENSE BURST OF LIQUID SPRAYS OUT OF THE SEAM. HITS THE THREE DIGGERS. MELTS THEIR SKIN CLEAN OFF. They SCREAM. Dying horribly. IT BURROWS IT'S WAY UP HIS FAT BELLY AND ACROSS HIS HAIRY CHEST. The Warden claws and scratches at it, trying to stop it. The lump BURROWS UP HIS NECK. The Warden starts GAGGING and COUGHING. WE PUSH IN over the lip of the coffin, then closer and closer towards Imhotep's rotten, twisted head, until his putrid face fills FRAME, -- and then suddenly his crusty eyelids Pop OPEN! Revealing EMPTY SOCKETS. -- BIG SCARY MUSIC STING.

direction.raw_text: He skids to a stop as a strange, piercing WHINE is heard, coming from out in the desert. O'Connell and the others all leap to their feet. The Americans run out of their tents. The SOUND gets LOUDER and CLOSER. And then from out of the darkness a HUGE WALL OF LOCUSTS SWIRLS into camp and envelops everyone. O'Connell grabs Evelyn, and with Jonathan at their side they race for the crevice, trying to fend off the horrid vermin as they go. Beni and the Americans run for the temple. The Egyptologist is covered in locusts. He stares at The Book Of The Dead, looking haunted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT O'Connell, Evelyn and Jonathan race up the staircase, just ahead of the mass of SCURRYING, CHITTERING SCARABS. O'Connell leaps out onto a pedestal. Jonathan jumps up next to him. Evelyn jumps up into a grotto on the other side of the narrow stairway. The horrible herd of vicious scarabs scurries between them, their ear-piercing CHITTERS send shivers up Evelyn's spine. She leans back. THE WALL MOVES. Evelyn falls backwards through an opening. O'Connell and Jonathan watch the scarabs vanish up the staircase. Then they look across the way. Evelyn is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn sits up, shakes the sand out of her hair, fearfully looks around. It's almost PITCH BLACK. She gets up and feels her way along the dark walls. She rounds a corner. A shaft of MOONLIGHT filters in through a crack in the ceiling. A MAN stands in the middle of the room. Evelyn walks towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just as she reaches him he turns around. It's Burns. BOTH OF HIS EYES ARE MISSING. He stares at her with vacant sockets. Evelyn SCREAMS in horror and backs away, hyperventilating, she bumps into something. She SCREAMS again and spins around It's Imhotep. With two fresh EYEBALLS in his sockets. Evelyn SCREAMS again and backs away into a wall. Her hair is down, her face is dirty and sweaty, her blouse is ripped, her dress is torn, she's never looked sexier. Imhotep SQUINTS.

direction.raw_text: Beni slowly backs up around Anubis, eyes wide, gun up. He turns around, -- IMHOTEP IS RIGHT THERE! Beni SCREAMS, backs away and OPENS FIRE. Six GUNSHOTS perforate Imhotep, but have no effect except to SPLATTER molten flesh rot onto the back wall. Beni retreats into a corner, scared shitless. Imhotep moves forward, his one hand trying to stop the molten mummy guts from oozing out of the large shotgun hole in his side. Beni drops his gun and grabs at the CHAINS around his neck, RELIGIOUS SYMBOLS AND ICONS dangle from each chain. Beni holds the first one up: A CHRISTIAN CRUCIFIX. He quickly makes the sign of-the cross and blesses himself in English:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It has no effect on Imhotep, who continues forward. Beni quickly grabs at the other symbols and icons, holding them out towards Imhotep, one after the other, trying to slow his progress: an Islamic Sword and Crescent Moon necklace; a Hindu Brahma medallion; a small Buddhist Bodhisattva statue. All while blessing himself in Arabic, Hindi, Chinese and Latin. Nothing works. Imhotep's skeletal hand reaches for Beni's throat. Tears run down Beni's cheeks he's so freaked. And that's when he holds up THE STAR OF DAVID and blesses himself in HEBREW. Imhotep stops in his tracks. His hand lowers. His grotesque new eyeballs stare at Beni.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: -- HIS BODY IS SHRIVELED TO HALF IT'S SIZE

direction.raw_text: onnell and Evelyn race into the room, past the Servant who is running out SCREAMING. They skid to a stop as they spot Burns, or what's left of him, lying dead on the floor, -- HIS BODY IS SHRIVELED TO HALF IT'S SIZE. Drained of all organs and liquids. O'Connell and Evelyn are shocked. Then they hear a LOUD MOAN and notice Imhotep standing on the far side of the room. O'Connell draws his gun. Imhotep is REGENERATING: A thick skin FORMS over powerful new musculature. His tendons RIPPLE. His bones BULGE and REFORM. His mouth opens to an inhuman size as he MOANS and CRIES OUT, in severe pain. And then it's over. And he looks like an incredibly muscular, corpse-like vision from hell. The 'Terminator' Mummy. O'Connell and Evelyn are stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imhotep starts to move towards them, staring at Evelyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imhotep keeps coming. O'Connell OPENS FIRE. BLASTING Imhotep Bullets RIP through his body. Imhotep doesn't seem to mind. Jonathan, Henderson and Daniels run into the room. They're all stunned at the sight of Imhotep. O'Connell steps forward, throws a RIGHT HOOK, punches Imhotep in the face, -- HIS FIST GOES THROUGH IMHOTEP'S SKULL AND GETS STUCK DEEP INSIDE HIS HEAD. O'Connell stares at it, shocked, then quickly YANKS his fist back out. The area of Imhotep's face that came into contact with O'Connell's fist quickly DEGENERATES and DECAYS, right down to the bone, as if O'Connell's hand instantly infected it. Imhotep angrily turns, grabs O'Connell, and with no effort, THROWS him across the room and into Jonathan and the others knocking them down. Imhotep looks at his hand, the one that just grabbed O'Connell, -- IT STARTS TO SHRIVEL and DECAY. He quickly turns to Evelyn. Evelyn backs away into a wall, terrorized. Imhotep steps up to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leans in, about to kiss her with his decayed face. And that's when a WHITE CAT jumps onto the piano, HISSING. Imhotep SHRIEKS. The balcony doors BLOW OPEN. Imhotep spins into a BLAST OF WIND AND SAND and SWIRLS out the doors. Gone. O'Connell, Evelyn, Jonathan and Daniels stand transfixed. Henderson kneels next to Burns, shriveled body, horrified.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just saw my fist vanish into some guy's head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm willin, to go on a little faith, here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You will not believe it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Try me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Everyone is assembled around the tomb display of Seti The First. We recognize his chariot and sword. The Curator sits on Seti's throne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daniels is totally wigged-out, he looks at O'Connell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Curator and Ardeth Ray look at Evelyn, thunderstruck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jonathan scratches his ear with the barrel of his pistol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ardeth Ray has been staring out a wall of windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone follows Ardeth Ray's eyes, through the windows we can see the SUN, -- which is now going into a FULL ECLIPSE.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We are part of an ancient secret society, the cult-of-the-Mumia, and we have a sacred mission, passed down through thirty-nine generations. For over four thousand years we have guarded The City Of The Dead. we are sworn at manhood to do any and all in our power to stop the High Priest Imhotep from being reborn into this world.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And because of you, we have failed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (appalled) And you think this justifies killing innocent people!?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To have stopped this creature? Yes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, let's cut to the chase. He's afraid of cats, what's that about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: According to the ancients, cat's are the guardians at the gates of the underworld. Imhotep will fear them until he is fully regenerated, and then he will fear nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right! And ya know how he gets fully regenerated?! By killing everybody who opened that chest and sucking us dry! That's how!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, the creature must first try and regenerate, and then he will attempt to resurrect the one he has loved for more than four thousand years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anck-su-namun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In the necropolis, when I saw him, - alive,... walking, he called me Anck- su-namun. And then in Mister Burns' quarters he tried to kiss me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is because it was you who read from the Book. He has chosen you to be the human sacrifice needed to regenerate the body of Anck-su-namun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is not good. Not good at all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tonight is the full moon. The moon of Osiris. It will begin tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...and he stretched forth his hands towards the heavens, and there was darkness throughout the land of Egypt."
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: onnell looks out a window at the British Soldiers manning the walls. Above and beyond them, -- is the BLACK SUN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evelyn and Jonathan are pacing the foyer
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns to Daniels and Henderson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell turns from the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell looks at Evelyn, Daniels and Henderson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All three of them pounce on him at once -- HENDERSON The hell with that! I'm not goin' nowhere! We're safe here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell just shakes his head and SIGHS. Totally put-upon. Then he takes Evelyn, shoves her into the bedroom, slams the door and locks it with a skeleton key. From inside her room we can hear Evelyn POUNDING on the door and YELLING. O'Connell throws the skeleton key to Daniels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jonathan swallows hard and points to himself.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We must stop him from regenerating.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who opened that chest?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, there was me and Daniels here and then poor Burns of course, oh yeah, and that Egyptologist fella.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about my buddy, Beni?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Naw, he scrammed outta there,
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We must find the Egyptologist and bring him back here to the safety of the fort, before the creature can get to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay,... Evelyn, you wait here, you two come with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I'm not leavin, this fort for nothin'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who put you in charge? You can't just leave me behind like some old suitcase. I'm the one responsible for this mess and I intend to be the one to clean it up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Keep an eye on her. If you leave her door, I'll rip your spleen out. C'mon, Jonathan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - BAZAAR - DAY FOR NIGHT The Egyptologist stumbles through the dark alleys, looking haunted. He clutches the Book of The Dead in one hand and his SACRED CANOPIC JAR in the other. Imhotep is stalking him. A STREET VENDOR turns and sees Imhotep's horribly decayed face. He reacts and scurries away. Imhotep lifts his robe, covers his face, and moves in on the Egyptologist, who is heading into the bazaar. WE PAN UP TO -- THE EGYPTOLOGIST'S OFFICE - DAY FOR NIGHT Beni is RANSACKING the joint, pulling out drawers and files and throwing them on the floor. He finds a silver pocket watch, shakes it, then throws it into his pocket, then he starts tipping over bookcases and clearing shelves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beni spins around. O'Connell and Jonathan stand in the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beni turns and runs for an open window. O'Connell grabs a chair, FLINGS IT into his path. Beni TRIPS and CRASHES into a wall. O'Connell strides over, grabs him and lifts him up the wall. Beni's feet dangle off the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell quickly slides his knife up under Beni's chin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell shoves the knife deeper into Beni's skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O'Connell looks at Jonathan. Beni seizes the moment and KNEES O'Connell in the balls. O'Connell doubles over and collapses. Beni leaps out the window. Jonathan cringes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's when they hear a BLOOD CURDLING SCREAM coming from down in the bazaar. O'Connell and Jonathan scramble to the window and look out -- EXT. BAZAAR - DAY FOR NIGHT Down in the bazaar, people are SCREAMING and quickly backing away from the SHRIVELED CORPSE OF THE EGYPTOLOGIST. A partially decayed HAND reaches down and takes the sacred canopic jar out of the Egyptologist's shriveled hand. It's Imhotep, having regenerated even further. He looks up and catches eyes with O'Connell. Imhotep grins, then UNHINGES; his jaw, his mouth stretches to an inhuman size, and then a huge SWARM OF FLIES comes out of his mouth and races straight up at O'Connell and Jonathan. They both SLAM the shutters. The flies SLAM into the closed window and immediately spread throughout the bazaar. Sending people SCREAMING and running.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Well, well, well.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lemme guess, spring cleaning?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's your new friend?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What friend? You're my only friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then you got no excuse for living. What the hell you doin, being buddies with this creep, Beni? What's in it for you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is better to be the right hand of the Devil,... than in his path. As long as I serve him, I am immune.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Immune from what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You shall see.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you looking for? Lie, and I'll slit your throat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The book! The black book they found at Hamunaptra! Imhotep wants it back. Said to me it would be worth it's weight in diamonds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What does he want the book for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrugs) Something about bringing his dead girly-friend back to life. He needs the book... (looks at Jonathan) And your sister.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That looked rather painful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wincing) Ya know, ever since I met you, my luck has been for crap.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, I know, I do that to people.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - DAY FOR NIGHT O'Connell and Jonathan look at each other, panicked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They turn and race out of the office.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Damn-it! That's two down and only two to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And then he'll be coming after Evy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - WINDOW --NIGHT Daniels stares out a window, watching the British Guards at the front gate. More Soldiers march the encircling parapet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lights and MUSIC from the Casbah come up from below
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ten o'clock! All is well!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Daniels turns from the window. Henderson sits in a chair next to Evelyn's door, chain smoking. Both look wired with fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daniels nods and heads out. Henderson just sits there, alone, smoking. He reaches into his jacket pocket, pulls out his SACRED CANOPIC JAR and fondles it. A BREEZE suddenly comes in through the open window. The curtains flutter. Henderson gets up and goes over to shut it. He looks out the window. The CAMERA races over the compound, into the window and HITS Henderson square in the FACE just as he's about to scream. Henderson is lifted into the air by a mass of SWIRLING SAND. His body TWISTS and TURNS and slowly SHRIVELS as the life is SUCKED out of him. Then he COLLAPSES to the floor. On the wall above him, the SHADOW of the SWIRLING SAND condenses, forming a SHADOW of a human body. The SHADOW CONVULSES as the body REGENERATES. And then it's over. Imhotep steps into view. He's regenerated even further and looks almost normal now, his face no longer decayed. He steps over Henderson's shriveled body and up to Evelyn's door, rattles the knob. It's locked. Imhotep grins.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The hell with this. I'm goin, downstairs to get me a drink. You want somethin'?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, get me a glass of bourbon, a shot of bourbon and a bourbon chaser.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evelyn is asleep in her bed as SAND begins streaming in through the keyhole, pouring onto the floor, forming a large mound. Evelyn starts to toss and turn. WE PAN BACK OVER TO THE DOOR: The mound of sand is gone and in it's place is Imhotep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: onnell and Jonathan race into the foyer and skid to a stop as they see Henderson's shriveled body on the floor. O'Connell runs up to Evelyn's door and rattles the knob, still locked. He bends down and looks in through the KEYHOLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imhotep leans down towards Evelyn, about to kiss her as she sleeps. The door starts to CRASH and BANG from O'Connell. Imhotep ignores it. And KISSES Evelyn. His lips and mouth instantly start to DEGENERATE and DECAY. Right down to the bone. The door BURSTS OPEN. Evelyn wakes up. Sees Imhotep's rotted mouth kissing her. She SCREAMS and shoves him away. Imhotep's putrid mouth grimaces in sadness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imhotep's sadness turns to anger as he spins around and faces O'Connell. Imhotep licks his fetid lips. O'Connell smirks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imhotep starts to move for O'Connell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He throws the white cat at Imhotep. Imhotep instinctively catches it. He SHRIEKS, drops the cat and stumbles back towards the window, -- which suddenly BLOWS OPEN. Imhotep spins like a dervish and BURSTS INTO A WHIRLWIND OF SAND. Everybody covers their eyes. The Imhotep/sand-devil EXPLODES out the window and vanishes over the compound. Jonathan aims his gun at the window, his hand shaking badly. O'Connell hugs Evelyn as she wipes her mouth in disgust. Daniels walks in, looks at Henderson's shriveled body on the floor... and drops the martini glasses.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get your hands off my girl, pal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nice lips.

result.heading: BURSTS INTO A WHIRLWIND OF SAND

dialogue.raw_text: I figured you might be here, so I brought a friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jonathan races his big convertible through the streets, HONKING constantly. Evelyn sits between him and O'Connell, looking scared and nervous, then she gives O'Connell a look.

direction.raw_text: Daniels leans forward from the back seat, filled with fear,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They race into the driveway of the museum of Antiquities.

dialogue.raw_text: You called me your girl?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?... Oh yeah, that was just um, you know, figure a speech.
